intro: Cerastium fontanum f. glutinosum, commonly known as sticky mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered in a dense layer of sticky hairs. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a waxy coating, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during late spring to early summer. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
